content:
• Monday, February 27, 2017
  • EOG

    EOG Resources +2% after beating Q4 estimates

    • EOG Resources (NYSE:EOG) +1.9% AH after posting a much smaller than expected Q4 loss and a 33% Y/Y jump in revenues, and guiding for 18% growth in FY 2017 total company crude oil volumes.
    • EOG sees 2017 capex of $3.7B-$4.1B vs. $2.7 billion in 2016, and expects to complete ~480 net wells compared to 445 net wells in 2016, with flat to lower completed well costs in 2017 as continued efficiencies and service contract expirations are expected to offset potential cost increases.
    • EOG says total net proved reserves rose 1.4% in 2016 to 2.14B boe (55% crude oil and condensate, 19% natural gas liquids, 26% natural gas) and it replaced 163% of 2016 production at a $5.22/boe finding and development cost (excluding price revisions).
     
     
     
     
    | 6:22 PM | 8 Comments
  • NOW

    Cowen and Company reiterates ServiceNow at Outperform following CEO modification [updated]

    • Analyst Derrick Wood notes ServiceNow's appointment of John Donahoe to president and CEO (formerly president and CEO of eBay, present chairman of the board at PayPal) indicates positively as the company targets $4B in revenue for 2020.
    • Price target maintained at $110. ServiceNow (NYSE:NOW) $87.75, -4.43% (at close).
    • Earlier (February 27, 2017): ServiceNow -3.8% amid disclosure of CEO change
    • Update (5:58PM ET): Similarly reiterated positively at Mizuho Securities (Buy, $100 target).
     
     
     
     
    | 5:53 PM

  • DRYS

    DryShips +20% on new dividend policy

    • DryShips (NASDAQ:DRYS) +20.3% AH after announcing a new dividend policy in which it will pay a regular fixed quarterly dividend of $2.5M to shareholders, and possibly pay additional amounts each quarter depending on market conditions and the company's financial performance.
    • The dividend likely will work out to ~$0.07/share on a quarterly basis.
    • DRYS had plunged to a new 52-week low during regular trading, -16.5% on more than double the average daily volume on new specific news.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM | 43 Comments
  • HUM

    Humana inks accelerated stock buyback program; $1.5B invested today

    • Humana (NYSE:HUM) entered into an accelerated stock repurchase (ASR) agreement with Goldman Sachs on February 22. The program is part of the $2.25B share repurchase plan that the company announced on February 14.
    • Today, it made a $1.5B payment and received 5,833,738 common shares from GS.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM
  • PRGO

    Perrigo 2016 top-line up 5%; non-GAAP EPS down 6%; shares off 10% after hours

    • Perrigo Company plc (NASDAQ:PRGO) preliminary 2016 results ($M): Sales: $5,634.8 (+5.3%); Loss/share: ($28.85 - 29.00) due goodwill and intangible asset impairment charges of $5.4B; Non-GAAP EPS: $7.10 - 7.25 (-5.5% from midpoint).
    • Auditor E&Y is evaluating its historical revenue recognition practices related to Tysabri. Company says no assurance can be given that financial statements for one or more periods will not need restating.
    • The 10-K should be filed no later than March 16.
    • 2017 Guidance: EPS: $3.39 - 3.74; Non-GAAP EPS: $6.30 - 6.65. Tysabri EPS: $1.03 - 1.09; Non-GAAP Tysabri: $2.12 - 2.18.
    • Shares are down 10% after hours on increased volume.
    • Previously: Perrigo sells Tysabri royalty stream for up to $2.85B; CFO departure and soft 2017 guidance pressures shares; down 8% after hours (Feb. 27)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM | 20 Comments
  • FTR

    Frontier Communications -5.5% amid dips in customer base, average revenue

    • Frontier Communications (FTR -2.4%) is another 5.5% lower after dipping into the close, following Q4 earnings where it shed customers and average revenue dropped as it missed sales targets.
    • The board approved a reverse stock split (between 1-for-10 and 1-for-25) and will recommend it to shareholders for approval at the May annual meeting. It will set the final ratio within 90 days after the charter amendment is approved.
    • It's also amending credit facilities and combining them into a single agreement. That should grant the company more flexibility, it says, as well as upsizing its revolving credit to $850M and extending it from 2018 to 2022.
    • CEO Dan McCarthy says post-reorg annualized cost synergies should now be $1.6B by mid-2018, up from a previous $1.4B target.
    • Residential customers dropped to 4.89M from last quarter's 5.03M; yet average monthly revenue per customer fell to $80.33 from $82.34. Churn stayed at 2.08%.
    • Business customers dropped to 502,000 from 516,000; ARPU dipped there as well, to $665.04 from $668.30. Broadband subscribers fell to 4.27M from 4.36M, and video subscribers dropped to 1.42M from 1.5M.
    • For the year, adjusted free cash flow was $921M.
    • For 2017 it's forecasting adjusted free cash flow of $800M-$1B, capex of $1B-$1.25B, and cash taxes of $0 to $50M.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM | 37 Comments

  • X

    U.S. Steel +3% following after-hours upgrade from Cowen

    • U.S. Steel (NYSE:X) +3.2% AH after Cowen issues a late upgrade to Outperform from Market Perform with a Street-high $60 price target, up substantially from a prior $36 outlook.
    • The stock already jumped 3.2% in today's trade after Pres. Trump promised a "big statement" on infrastructure spending during tomorrow's address to Congress.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM | 8 Comments
  • WDAY

    Workday -2.55% after hours despite better-than-expected Q4 2017 results, FY 2018 revenue outlook

    • Q4 2017 results – revenue $436.67M (+35% Y/Y, $6.37M above estimates), EPS $0.07 ($0.08 above estimates), Subscription revenue $365.2M (+39% Y/Y), operating profit $8M (vs. $0.8M operating loss Y/Y)
    • Other developments – Workday Human Capital Management selected to replace BP's legacy on-premise HR system.
    • FY 2018 projections – revenue $2.005B-$2.025B (+27%-29%; consensus $1.99B)
    • Workday co-founder and CEO Aneel Bhusri: "In Q4, we delivered the best quarter in company history to close out a very successful fiscal 2017. Our strong performance was driven by a combination of our industry-leading products and technology, continued high levels of customer satisfaction, and our dedicated Workday team. We believe these are the right areas of focus to achieve another great year for Workday in the year ahead."
    • After hours – (NYSE:WDAY) $87.89.
    • Press release / conference call / 8-K
     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM | 2 Comments
  • SQ

    Square -1.7% on convertible offering

    • The company intends to sell $350M in 5-year convertible notes, with initial buyers granted an option to purchase up to another $52.5M of the paper.
    • SQ -1.7% after hours

  • BKNG

    Dazzling growth numbers from Priceline

    • Priceline (PCLN) reports profit increased 21% Y/Y in Q4 to $2.3B.
    • Q4 EBITDA of $869M vs. $818M consensus estimate and the company's forecast of $755M to $795M.
    • Total gross bookings were up 26% to $15.112B. Merchant bookings increased 28% during the quarter.
    • Priceline earnings release (.pdf)
    • Previously: Priceline beats by $1.23, beats on revenue (Feb. 27)
    • PCLN +1.78% AH to $1661.00.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM | 27 Comments
  • I

    Intelsat +25% on reports SoftBank wants to merge it, OneWeb

    • Intelsat (NYSE:I) vaulted into a news-pending halt, up 25%, on word from Sky News that SoftBank (OTCPK:SFTBY -1.7%) is in advanced talks to combine Intelsat with OneWeb.
    • That would create a satellite business with an enterprise value of about $18B, and SoftBank would commit to reducing some of Intelsat's debt -- which amounts to about $15.4B at last report.
    • The companies aren't commenting, but a deal could be outlined alongside Intelsat's earnings report tomorrow if it goes through, Sky News says.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM | 39 Comments

  • SBY

    Silver Bay sold to Tricon Capital; up 20% after hours

    • The all-cash deal works out to $21.50 per share vs. today's close of $18.17. Shares are higher by 20% after hours to $21.79. The deal puts a $1.4B enterprise value on Silver Bay (NYSE:SBY).
    • The sale is expected to close in Q2.
    • The announcement came alongside Q4 results. Tomorrow's conference call has been cancelled.
    • Tricon Capital trades in Toronto and on the OTC here under (OTC:TCNGF).

  • LJPC

    Jefferies boosts price target on La Jolla to $40 after positive late-stage study of LJPC-501

    • Stoked by the successful ATHOS-3 study, Jefferies analyst Eun Yang raises her price target on La Jolla Pharmaceuticals (LJPC +76.6%) to $40 (14% upside) from $27 (the current price is $35 so some sort of revision was necessary). She maintains her Buy rating on the stock.
    • Earlier today, SunTrust Banks reiterated its Buy rating and raised the price target to $57 (63% upside).
    • Chardan Capital rates it a "Top Pick" with a $75 (114% upside) price target.
    • Source: Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM | 3 Comments
  • BAS

    Basic Energy adds 74K hhp of pressure pumping equipment

    • Basic Energy Services (BAS +6.1%) maintains strong gains following news that it signed a $28.5M purchase agreement for a 74K horsepower hydraulic pump to be used in two frac spreads beginning in May.
    • BAS says the purchase will bring its total frac hhp to 431,650 and total hhp to 517,445.
    • CEO Roe Patterson says BAS has seen an increase in frac activity in its Permian Basin and Mid-Continent operating areas and expects to have all remaining stacked fleet activated by the end of March, and has improved its frac pricing by 5%-15% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM
  • ATRA

    Biotechs scorching today, IBB up 3%

    • Biotech investors are breaking out the champagne today as the sector enjoys its best day in a month. The iShares Nasdaq Biotechnology ETF (IBB +2.8%) is up on increased volume as it approaches 300, a level last touched in September 2016.
    • Healthcare movers (some buoyed by specific news): (ATRA +15.6%)(LJPC +79.1%)(HTGM +156.9%)(GILD +0.7%)(AMGN +0.8%)(BIIB +2%)(VRTX +3.1%)(BMY +0.3%)(LLY +0.5%)(PFE +0.2%)(INCY +2.6%)(REGN +3.1%)(ACOR +10.6%)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM | 21 Comments
  • SUN

    Sunoco downgraded at FBR on expected de-leveraging scenario

    • Sunoco LP (SUN -4.2%) is downgraded to Market Perform from Outperform with a $28 price target, trimmed from $32, at FBR, after Q4 earnings fell short of expectations, reducing the firm's forecasts for EBITDA and increasing leverage.
    • FBR says it continues to believe SUN has multiple options available for reducing leverage, but most options strain cash flows, and sustaining distribution coverage for the longer term has become a greater concern.
    • The firm says its previous expectations of preferred equity and an IDR waiver remain helpful in reducing leverage, but with tempered cash flow forecasts, distribution coverage remains an issue once IDRs are reinstated.
    • The firm continues to believe sponsor Energy Transfer Equity (ETE +0.4%) will protect SUN's cash flows, perhaps even via a takeout scenario similar to Plains All American and Plains GP.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:22 PM | 87 Comments
  • VRAY

    FDA clears ViewRay's next-gen radiation therapy system; shares up 26%

    • Thinly traded ViewRay (VRAY +26.1%) is up on a healthy 26x surge in volume in response to its announcement that the FDA has granted 510(k) clearance for its MRIdian Linac, its next-generation linear accelerator-based MRI-guided radiation therapy system.
    • The first two installations are slated for Henry Ford Hospital in Detroit and Barnes-Jewish Hospital at Washington University in St. Louis.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:15 PM | 5 Comments
  • UA

    Nomura cites margin risk at Under Armour

    • Nomura lowers Under Armour (UA, UAA) to a Reduce rating from Hold on concerns that the high-growth quarters from the company are in the rear-view mirror.
    • Under Armour also faces some margin risk due to a higher mix of low-margin footwear sales, warns the Japanese firm.
    • UA -2.82%. UAA -1.47%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM | 17 Comments

  • CCL

    Argus turns positive on Carnival

    • Argus upgrades Carnival (CCL) to a Buy rating after having the cruise line operator set at Hold.
    • The firm sets a price target of $64 to imply 14% upside potential for shares from current levels.
    • Wall Street ratings scorecard on CCL: 14 Buys, 8 Holds, 1 Sell.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • BHP

    BHP CEO says talks have resumed at strike-hit Escondida mine

    • BHP Billiton (BHP +1.7%) has resumed talks with striking workers at its Escondida copper mine in Chile in an effort to reach a wage agreement, CEO Andrew Mackenzie tells Bloomberg, although the union said yesterday that no discussions were being held.
    • The CEO says the Escondida workforce already is "extremely well paid," and asks workers to approach issues of productivity and flexibility so the mine can continue to be profitable and provide jobs when ore grades decline in the future.
    • BHP says the walkout by members of the union representing 2,500 workers - now in its third week - means it is reviewing its guidance for copper output of 1.62M tons in the 12 months to June 30, including 1.07M tons forecast for Escondida.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM
  • RIG

    Transocean reiterated at Sell by BMO amid Barron's bump

    • Transocean (RIG +3.7%) enjoys a Barron's bump after a weekend article said shares could rise more than 35% in the next year or two if oil prices top $60/bbl.
    • But BMO analysts are reiterating their Sell rating on RIG, saying that despite recent success in cutting costs and improving sales, the company's net asset value still points to shares being worth just $10.
    • The firm also contends that “M&A may be moving up the agenda,” thus increasing the probability of issuing equity to purchase a smaller, distressed competitor.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM | 6 Comments
  • WTW

    Weight Watchers gets perky ahead of results; +5.5%

    • The company is expected to report tomorrow after the close. The stock got off to a good start today after M Science said Q4 came in just fine, with online signups growing at the fastest pace in three years. It's added noticeably to those gains in the past few minutes.
    • WTW +5.5%
     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM | 9 Comments

  • AIG

    AIG board mulling actions against CEO - WSJ

    • Among the items up for debate at an early March board meeting, according to the report, would be cutting CEO Peter Hancock's bonus, or firing him.
    • At issue is poor performance at the insurer, including Q4's $3B loss which sent the stock down 9% in one session earlier this month.
    • The news has sent AIG from a small loss to higher by 1.15% on the session.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:50 PM | 16 Comments
  • LB

    Victoria's Secret takes high-priced bras to China

    • The first regular Victoria's Secret store in China opened recently in Shangahi to quite a bit of fanfare.
    • A second store is planned for Chengdu by the end of the year.
    • In an interesting twist, Victoria's Secret plans to take its annual show of lingerie and underwear to Shanghai on the company's view the local market is ready for 600 yuan ($87) bras.
    • Last week, L Brands (LB +2.5%) crumbled off of a weak performance by the Victoria's Secret brand, due in part to a higher mix of lower-margin sports bras and bralettes sales. Shares of LB are up 8.8% from their low point of $47.93.
    • Previously: Weakness at Victoria's Secret impacts L Brands (Feb. 22)
    • Previously: Amazon has a bra plan (Feb. 12)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:09 PM | 8 Comments
  • JKS

    Jinko Solar +4% after stronger than expected Q4

    • Jinko Slar (JKS +4.1%) is higher following a strong Q4 earnings beat, as module shipments rose 7.9% Q/Q and 1.3% Y/Y to 1,733 MW during Q4 and 6,656 MW for FY 2016, making it the world’s biggest PV module producer.
    • JKS says Q4 revenues fell 21% Y/Y to $737M despite increased shipments but the result still exceeded analyst expectations.
    • The company forecasts solar module shipments of 1.9-2.0 GW for Q1 and 8.5-9.0 GW for FY 2017.
    • JKS also says it received “rush orders” from Chinese developers towards the end of 2016, a trend it expects to continue during H1 2017, and that ASPs in the U.S. have begun to stabilize after a sharp decline during the quarter.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM | 5 Comments

    • Losers: GRAM-OLD -27%. ITUS -19%. SSTK -19%. DRYS -17%. NVFY -16%. AFSI -16%. ARGS -12%. EYEG -9%. RTTR -9%. CARV -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 6 Comments
  • SSL

    Sasol sees first Mozambique oil production in 2-3 years

    • Sasol (SSL +1.7%) says it has found oil in wells off Mozambique and aims to start production there for the first time, co-CEO Stephen Cornell tells Reuters in an interview after the company announced H1 results.
    • While Mozambique is primarily a gas play, Cornell says SSL has "drilled four wells, two of them gas, two of them oil, all showing positive results. In one of the areas where we expected mostly gas we found gas and oil."
    • "This will be the first oil wells in Mozambique that go to full development - probably in two, maximum three years." Cornell adds.
    • SSL says it is scaling back planned capex this year to 66B South African rand (~$5B) from 75B rand in the face of a strengthening rand as it posted a 38% drop in interim earnings, in line with what the company had previously flagged to the market.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM

  • Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 pm

    • Gainers: AMWD +9%. VOXX +7%.
    • Losers: NVFY -14%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM | 2 Comments
  • AES

    AES -4% after big Q4 revenue miss, below consensus 2017 EPS guidance

    • AES Corp. (AES -4.4%) plunges after its Q4 earnings results include a sharp revenue miss and below consensus FY 2017 earnings expectations.
    • AES sees 2017 EPS of $1.00-$1.10 vs. $1.11 analyst consensus estimate, and guides for consolidated free cash flow from operations of $2B-$2.8B with 8%-10% average annual growth, and adjusted EPS through 2020 off the midpoint of its 2016 expectation of $525M-$625M.
    • AES also says it expects to raise at least $500M in equity proceeds from asset sales in 2017 that will be reallocated in 2017-18.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM
  • NVFY

    Nova Lifestyle peels back after monster rally

    • Another bouncy day is in store for Nova Lifestyle (NASDAQ:NVFY) as volume on the stock remains elevated on the online furniture seller.
    • Shares of Nova are currently down 16% to cut into the recent +50% five-day rally tied partially to blockchain news.
    • Previously: Nova Lifestyle pops after blockchain news (Feb. 23)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM
  • FCX

    Shareholders want Freeport McMoRan to get tough with Indonesia, CEO says

    • Shareholders are pressuring Freeport McMoRan (FCX +1.9%) to stand up to the Indonesian government over changes the country wants to make in the miner's contract, with many of them believing FCX has "been too nice," CEO Richard Adkerson says.
    • The CEO says Rio Tinto (RIO +1.4%), a partner in FCX's Grasberg copper and gold mine in Indonesia, also supports the company's tougher approach.
    • In some of his strongest language yet, Adkerson says Indonesia's new regulations are "in effect a form of expropriation of our assets, and we are resisting it aggressively."
    • FCX remains locked in a standoff with the Indonesian government over permission to export copper concentrate produced at Grasberg, which accounts for about a third of its annual copper production and 40%-50% of the value of its worldwide assets.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM | 26 Comments
  • HTGM

    HTG Molecular to offer direct-DNA sequencing in March; shares jump 105%

    • Thinly traded nano cap HTG Molecular Diagnostics (HTGM +104.9%) gallops up on a healthy 63x surge in volume (2.6M shares) in response to its announcement that it will offer its new direct-target sequencing chemistry as a service starting next month.
    • The chemistry is designed for direct sequencing of DNA and, eventually, RNA targets , with the same sensitivity and specificity as its current HTG EdgeSeq chemistry applications.
    • The initial panel will detect mutations in the EGFR, KRAS and BRAF genes for retrospective research studies, particularly from small and difficult-to-analyze samples such as formalin-fixed paraffin-embedded tissue.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM
  • NOW

    ServiceNow -3.8% amid disclosure of CEO change

    • Current ServiceNow president, CEO and board chairman Frank Slootman to depart from management April 3, 2017 (will remain board chairman), with John Donahoe (president and CEO of eBay from 2008 to 2015, current PayPal board chairman) to become president and CEO. [press release]
    • ServiceNow (NYSE:NOW) $88.30.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM | 14 Comments
  • VEON

    VimpelCom becoming VEON; -1.6% after revenue miss

    • After a strong open, VimpelCom (VIP) is off 1.6% following a miss on revenues in its Q4 results alongside news that it's rebranding to VEON as it pursues ambitions as a global tech company.
    • The company is rolling out its new image (VEON will be the name of the company and its personal Internet platform) at Mobile World Congress in Barcelona this week.
    • Revenue by region: Russia, $1.1B (up 2.6%); Pakistan, $369M (up 44.4%); Algeria, $246M (down 17.5%); Bangladesh, $152M (down 0.3%); Ukraine, $150M (down 1.4%); Uzbekistan, $165M (down 9.8%); other and eliminations, $150M (down 9.6%).
    • It will also pursue a second listing on Euronext Amsterdam in Q2, to broaden its European investor base.
    • It's targeting total organic revenue growth in 2017 of low single digits, as well as underlying equity free cash flow of $700M-$800M (and more than $1B for 2018).
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM | 7 Comments
  • VISN

    VisionChina +7.4% as it reverses subway ad deal with Ledman

    • VisionChina Media (NASDAQ:VISN) is up 7.4% after saying it's terminating a recently closed sale of nearly half its subway TV ad business, over operating disagreements.
    • The company had been set for some time to sell a 49% interest in VisionChina New Culture Media, its business operating mobile TV advertising on subways, to Ledman Optoelectronic -- and it closed that deal in September. Last February, it had planned to sell the entire business to Ledman for $119M, but Ledman worked to suspend that deal and it was later terminated.
    • Now, with disagreements over how to operate New Culture, VisionChina will regain the 49% interest in the business and repay Ledman 61M yuan along with interest, in three installments. It will also repay 321.2M yuan in cash by selling 17.09M shares of Ledman, now pledged as collateral.
    • "The company is actively seeking potential purchasers of such equity interest. The company is also exploring other ways to improve its liquidity position," it says in a statement.

    La Jolla's angiotensin II successful in late-stage study; shares ahead 73%

    • Thinly traded La Jolla Pharmaceuticals (LJPC +72.7%) rallies on a whopping 44x surge in volume in response to its announcement of positive results from a Phase 3 clinical trial, ATHOS-3, assessing LJPC-501 (angiotensin II) in patients with catecholamine-resistant hypotension (CRH), an acute life-threatening condition in which blood pressure drops to dangerously low levels despite treatment.
    • The study met its primary endpoint of demonstrating a statistically valid percentage of patients achieving a pre-specified target blood pressure response. 70% (n=114/163) of LJPC-501-treated subjects achieved the blood pressure target compared to 23% (n=36/158) for placebo (p<0.00001) with a 22% lower risk of death (hazard ratio = 0.78).
    • The company plans to submit a marketing application in the U.S. in H2.
    • LJPC-501 is a proprietary formulation of angiotensin II, which acts to stabilize blood pressure and help the kidneys balance body fluids and electrolytes.

  • CLRB

    Cellectar Bio's lead product candidate shows positive effect in early-stage multiple myeloma study; shares ahead 14%

    • Nano cap Cellectar Biosciences (CLRB +14%) heads north on average volume in response to its announcement of encouraging results from a Phase 1 clinical trial assessing lead product candidate CLR 131 in patients with relapsed/refractory multiple myeloma (MM).
    • All four patients in Cohort 3 (25 mCi/m2) achieved stable disease after a single-dose infusion of CLR 131 with no unexpected adverse events (AEs). The AEs observed were predictable and manageable. They are being followed for progression-free survival (PFS) and median overall survival (OS).
    • Median OS in Cohort 1 (12.5 mCi/m2) is 17.7 months to date while Cohort 2 (18.75 mCi/m2) is 8.4 months. Both are increasing. Median PFS is 92 days and 133 days, respectively. Based on the data, the company has the option of selecting 18.75 mCi/m2 as the optimal dose for future clinical trials.
    • CLR 131 is a phospholipid ether-drug conjugate that selectively delivers a cytotoxic payload to cancer cells. The basis for the selectivity is the difference in the plasma membranes of cancer cells compared to normal cells. Cancer cell membranes are highly enriched with regions called lipid rafts which contain high concentrations of cholesterol and sphingolipids, a type of fatty acid containing a sugar molecule.
    • Previously: Cellectar Bio advancing lead product candidate CRL 131, mid-stage study in multiple myeloma to start this quarter (Feb. 22)

  • BCRX

    BioCryst Pharma's next-generation killikrein inhibitor shows positive effect in mid-stage HAE study; shares ahead 4% premarket

    • BioCryst Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:BCRX) is up 4% premarket on average volume in response to its announcement of encouraging results in a Phase 2 clinical trial, APeX-1, assessing its next-generation killikrein inhibitor, BCX7353, as a preventative treatment to reduce the frequency of attacks in patients with hereditary angioedema (HAE).
    • An interim analysis was performed on 24 HAE subjects who completed 28 days of treatment (BCX7353 = 11; placebo = 13). The baseline attack rate was ~1/week and average C1 inhibitor levels were less than 20% of the normal mean (severe angioedema).
    • The treatment group showed a 63% reduction in attack rate (mean rate = 0.34/week) compared to 0.92/week for placebo (p=0.006). In the intent-to-treat population of 28 subjects, the mean attack rates were 0.44/week and 0.91/week, respectively (p=0.035).
    • Daily dosing with BCX7353 inhibited kallikrein throughout the 24-hour dosing interval with the degree of inhibition similar to that observed in healthy subjects in the Phase 1 study (same dose).
    • Treatment-emergent adverse events included common cold (n=3/14), diarrhea (n=4/12), flatulence (n=2/14) and fatigue (n=2/14).
    • The steady-state drug levels observed far exceeded the proposed therapeutic target range so APeX-1 has been amended to include a 62.5 mg once-daily regimen. The number of subjects in the 125 mg and 250 mg (both once-daily) has been increased to more fully characterize the dose response.
    • Management will host a conference call this morning at 9:00 ET to discuss the data.
    • Previously: BioCryst Pharma's mid-stage study of next-generation kallikrein inhibitor underway (Aug. 11, 2016)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:27 AM

    • Thinly traded nano cap OncoSec Medical (NASDAQ:ONCS) is up 19% premarket on increased volume in response to its announcement that the FDA has granted Fast Track status for ImmunoPulse IL-12 for the treatment of metastatic melanoma following progression on pembrolizumab (Merck's KEYTRUDA) or nivolumab (Bristol-Myers Squibb's Opdivo).
    • The Fast Track designation provides for more frequent interactions with the FDA review team and a rolling review of the NDA.
